website_summaries.verdict: A relatively inexpensive and simple to use tool that turns your homemade bread into decent sandwich slices.
pros: Folds to a compact size for storage
cons: This slicer only allows you to slice one piece at a time before having to re-position the bread

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for bread pan sized loaves!
customer_reviews.text: I have a Zojirushi bread machine that I use the dough cycle on then bake two loaves in the oven in bread pans. Just my preference as they are the exact size as bread you find in the supermarket (I don’t like the tall bread maker loaves). This slicer is so perfect for me. I use on a rubber mat and even though it moves a little the slices are perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Miranda

customer_reviews.title: Love. Love. Love.
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! Makes slicing the keto bread I make so easy & consistent. I love that I can select the thickness as well.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl O

customer_reviews.title: It works, and for the price, it is not bad
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 issues with this, otherwise I would have given 5 stars. First, the knife slot springs closed at the top so you have to get your fingernail in to pry it open to get the knife in - annoying. Second, the base does not lock at a right angle so if you are not VERY careful, your cut will not be straight. Third, we bought this because we bought a bread maker. I am sure most bread machines are a standard size.. anyway, the loaf does not fit smoothly in the slot. You have to squish it a bit to get it in. So.. I gave 3 stars because the price was right.
customer_reviews.author: Jan Powers

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect, excellent price! Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: I compared several different bread slicers and ended up choosing this one. I'm SO happy that I did because it was cheap AND it does the job perfectly! I make 1 1/2 lb. loaves in my bread machine and the bread fits perfect in the slicer. I was honestly gonna go with a $30 bamboo slicer but that's not even necessary (plus, bamboo tends to split over time). It's good quality and I couldn't be happier with It! I'm hard to please when it comes to kitchen gadgets so trust my review over others lol!
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: 5 slice thicknesses. Works well
customer_reviews.text: Folds to store neatly. Our bread maker loaves are a bit too wide so slight trimming allows the loaf to fit. The thinnest setting is similar to a sandwich slice. Four more thicknesses above that. Very good product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's a Gamble
customer_reviews.text: I started baking my own bread and would find that it was hard to get even slices so I thought I'd try this to help. Right out of the box I unfolded it and it broke. It collapses to save space and the part that folds in is held by teeny tiny little platic tabs and that's what did it. It is not unuseable but not worth sending it back. I mean it was only $10. I'll keep it and use it until it doesn't work at all and just toss it. I will definitely be buying a pricier one next time though.
customer_reviews.author: CherryAngel

customer_reviews.title: Not that easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good bread slicer but you'd better trim off the crust(s) all around the loaf or it will not fit into the device. Slides around uncontrollably even after I added rubber circular pads to the bottom. Guess I'll have to try something else to keep it from sliding. It's not that the bread knife is dull (the sharpest bread knife sold on Amazon) as attested when I cut my index finger with it and ended up in ER for stitches. It helps with the task of cutting bread machine loaves but I need to figure out how to keep it from sliding allover the counter when slicing bread that's why the 3 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: BIGMAC80

customer_reviews.title: Works Great! Folds for storage!
customer_reviews.text: I was afraid that it would not be strong and would break easily. It works great! If you loaf is too wide you can turn it to the side, so it will cut most loaves. Makes a perfect slice. I am super happy with it, plus the seller sent nice bread recipes. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t fit bread from bread machine
customer_reviews.text: Bread made in a standard bread machine is much too wide to fit into this slicer. Even if it did fit, you would need two or three people to operate it—one person to do the slicing, another to keep the loaf in place (it slips out of place when you try to cut it), and one to hold the whole thing steady on the other end. Not a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Spyglass

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt accommodate a bread maker large loaf
customer_reviews.text: Not useful for the loaves that come out of my Breville bread maker. I’ve had several bread makers over the years and I don’t think any of the finished loaves would fit in this slicer. However, I can only speak to my specific experience and my particular bread maker. I make 2lb loaves often and I have to squish them to fit. Once the loaf is in it doesn’t stay in place. It seems well made and is easy to clean but I’ll be donating it or returning it. Or maybe it would be useful for bagels. It just doesn’t work for my breville breads.
customer_reviews.author: Hill country love

customer_reviews.title: Straight even slices!!
customer_reviews.text: I am one of the people that can't cut bread in a straight line .. nope nada. This baby gives me straight even slices every time, in whatever width I want. Pros:. Straight even slices every time! Different widths for different uses. Light weight and easy to store. No bamboo splinters as you cut. Cons:. You get what you pay for. It is inexpensive plastic. I suspect that if your not careful it would break easily though we haven't experienced that. Some folks were concerned about the way the top pinches together. We have not found that to be a problem..it's easy enough to work around.
customer_reviews.author: ladybug

customer_reviews.title: No more wonky slices of bread
customer_reviews.text: Here's the deal: I buy a couple loaves of bread at the farmer's market every week. I have an awesome bread knife, but no talent when it comes to cutting even slices. Out of desperation I bought this plastic doohickey and it works! I like that it's adjustable and folds up for easy storage. So, if you're tired of destroying loaves of bread, embarrassed to serve lopsided sandwiches, or clogging your toaster with wedges of bread; then you NEED this slicing guide.
customer_reviews.author: Mark A. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Love this one
customer_reviews.text: Tried others, but this one is the best so far. It adjusts for different thicknesses which many others don't. The non-slip foot pads help hold it still when slicing, and it takes up very little space. In fact, I store it in my bread machine!
customer_reviews.author: TUG

customer_reviews.title: Bread Slicer-
customer_reviews.text: It works fine. Did a great job slicing my Home made flax seed oatmeal bread. For thge amount of money this slicer did a great job. I will update after couples months on its durability.
customer_reviews.author: Lais

customer_reviews.title: It does the job and can go in the dishwasher
customer_reviews.text: I was a little hesitant about getting this as some of the reviews didn’t think much of the quality of the plastic. The plastic does seem a ltlle brittle but so far it’s held up. It does the job. It give different thickness options and compared to other bread cutters it is small and unobtrusive enough to leave on the counter. I didn’t put on the rubber feet so I could put it in the dishwasher. Putting it on a silicone mat stabilizes it just fine
customer_reviews.author: Y. K.

customer_reviews.title: Never got to use it...
customer_reviews.text: I had ordered this when I order a new bread maker, but ultimately the breadmaker was a failure (I had the exact same model of breadmaker several years ago and it worked perfectly and then I didn't need to use it for a few years and when IO tried to use it again, it didn't work, so ordered a new breadmaker of the same model that I had but it failed to produce good loaves so returned that and went back to store bread). So I never got to use this item, but it looked like it could work.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Merriam

customer_reviews.title: Too much work to get even slices
customer_reviews.text: This is functional and hasn't fallen apart or anything, it's just a cheap gadget that requires too much effort to get an even slice. It's a bit too small to take even a small loaf of homemade bread, requiring you to trim off part of the loaf. If you don't push and hold the loaf into the slicer as hard as you can (requires three hands, really), you won't get even thin slices. I have had to throw away several slices because they came out uneven and paper thin or torn in half. Really kind of useless.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Mansfield

customer_reviews.title: Lunchtime Hero
customer_reviews.text: I love it! I have been suffering from lopsided cuts of yummy homemade bread all my life. This silly little thing has changed my lunches forever. It feels durable and cleans easily. it's even small enough to fit in my breadbox for easy use and storage. Thank you, Amazon for bringing me a lunchtime hero.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Finally, straight cut bread
customer_reviews.text: I have using a bread machine more this year and to my embarressment, can't seem to cut two pieces of bread the same thinkness to save me. Fairly inexpensive, doesn't take up a lot of room and at least now when I make a sandwich, the bread is consistent.
customer_reviews.author: kfinn

customer_reviews.title: Slicer works great
customer_reviews.text: My new slicer works very nicely. It has a nice variety of slice sizes, seems quite sturdy and neatly folds away. The bread from my bread maker fits snugly in the slicer (I have to work at it just a bit) and at first I was wishing it was a little more roomy but after thinking about it, I think it is an advantage because there is no slipping while slicing. They thought of everything!
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: This would probably work great on small loaves of bread
customer_reviews.text: The pros for this slicing guide: - It is adjustable for slice thickness - It is easy to clean - For small loaves of bread, I suspect that it works great Cons for this slicing guide: - For the loaves that I bake in my Zojirushi bread maker, they are simply too wide and too tall to work in this slicing guide.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne R. Urso

customer_reviews.title: It does the job.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, my roommate broke it the first time he touched it. It is not un-usable, but i'll replace it with something more sturdy as soon as I find one. If you make your own bread at home, it's a must have to get nice slices. I also bought this bread knife that is the bomb! Mercer Culinary Millennia 10-Inch Wide Wavy Edge Bread Knife, White. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Patty V

customer_reviews.title: Arrived Broken: Flimsy Plastic
customer_reviews.text: When I took it out of the box the folding plastic tray was broken at the connection point. If I held the bread firmly in place then I could slice, but the plastic is so flimsy that it was difficult for me to us. I did like how thin the slices were. This would be nice if it was sturdy, and I probably would have gotten better use if it arrived intact.
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use and it works well. I need to go to a smaller bread pan as the ones that I am using now are just a little to wide for this unit. Other than that, it works well and has a good adjustment for the thickness of the slices that you can cut. It is made of plastic and appears to be sturdy, but only time will determine that.
customer_reviews.author: W. T. Traylor

customer_reviews.title: Works Well Enough, But Broke After Short Time
customer_reviews.text: For a manual bread slicer it works reasonably well. I'm not sure how I'd improve it. On the other hand, there are a couple pieces that can be taken off, for cleaning presumably. One of the pieces broke after only 7 or 8 uses. I can still use it, sort of, but I am disappointed. If I could replace the piece for a reasonable price, I would, but I doubt the seller is available for that.
customer_reviews.author: Robert K

customer_reviews.title: MUCH better than bamboo.
customer_reviews.text: You can only cut a single slice at a time before removing that slice and resetting the loaf. I thought that would be a problem but the slices are very consistent and the unit is easy to use. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Bogey's Dad

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use, compact to store
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what it's supposed to do. It's a tight fit for the width of our homemade bread but it works. Much easier to cut bread compared to the bulky electric bread slicer we used before.
customer_reviews.author: William T.

customer_reviews.title: Great company!
customer_reviews.text: First one I received had broken in shipping. Eon immediately responded by sending a replacement. Excellent value and superior customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Karin Conover-Lewis

customer_reviews.title: I finally have even slices of bread
customer_reviews.text: You wouldn't think cutting even slices of bread would be hard, but for some reason it is! This works great for cutting even slices. Occasionally my loaf is a little tall, but I can usually manage to squeeze it in to this and slice it.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne K

customer_reviews.title: Handy slicing guide for those with limited space.
customer_reviews.text: I like how this folds up and stores away in a small amount of space. It also can slice a wide range of thicknesses and fits a large 2 lb loaf from my breadmaker. If you want to slice a lot of bread quickly this is probably not the slicer for you since you have to take the bread out of the slicer to get each slice out. It suits my needs nicely though.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Ritchie

customer_reviews.title: Slick
customer_reviews.text: Works very well for slicing a variety of breads, buns, bagels, biscuits, English muffins, etc. Adjustuable. Compact. I could wish it weren't plastic, but that is a very minor quibble. Just be careful not to lose the removable back plate while knocking crumbs into your trash can!
customer_reviews.author: MadKatter

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This does what you expect. The only thing I would do differently is order one that does more than one slice at at time and with a crumb catcher. I knew that beforehand though. Just didn't want spend a lot of money.
customer_reviews.author: Dortha A. Ayers

customer_reviews.title: Solid slicer with good adjustment options
customer_reviews.text: We have owned several of these low cost bread slicers and this one seems to be the most durable of the bunch. Good adjustability of the size of the slice and the unit fits the loaves from our 2 pound bread maker just perfectly. Very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Dakota Dude

customer_reviews.title: Stay against the back with knife!
customer_reviews.text: As others have said this is very nice although is cheaply made. Be sure to stay against the back side when slicing, my sharp bread knife sliced parts of the plastic off when slicing down through the bread loaf, which of course ended up in my bread although I could pick it out.
customer_reviews.author: turtle

customer_reviews.title: Just cut the bread
customer_reviews.text: I make my own bread. I really have to grip my bread and push it into the slicer to get even cuts. I have to remove each slice. No too impressed by it. I just couldn't find anything that suited my need. I guess there's not much of a demand. I feel like it won't last long.
customer_reviews.author: vettalink

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, low tech, plastic.... BUT IT WORKS GREAT
customer_reviews.text: I started baking and was really having trouble slicing my home made bread thin enough to put in the toaster or even enough for sandwiches.... Problem solved. This works well, was inexpensive and takes up extremely little room on the counter or in the drawer. I am very glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen L. Pepple

customer_reviews.title: Greatest thing ever
customer_reviews.text: This makes my homemade bread actually edible. I clearly am knife-challenged and can't cut straight so my bread was coming out either too thick or too thin. This makes every thing nice and uniform. Plus it folds up well so it doesn't take up much space in the cabinet and it cleans super well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Plastic is easily sliced by the knife
customer_reviews.text: I like the idea of this more than the actual item because although the concept is excellent there is no way to ensure that the knife doesn’t cut through the plastic. Which is what happened after only two uses. Plus the size is difficult for homemade bread to fit in.
customer_reviews.author: Larissa

customer_reviews.title: Simple and effective
customer_reviews.text: Great bread to companion. Love making homemade bread and great tool to help me cut clean slices without jacking up the bread. 😊
customer_reviews.author: Baby BeeTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected, great product, great value
customer_reviews.text: Works great, easy to use, and the materials are sturdy. I have cut both thick and thin slices and very pleased. I do have a good quality bread knife, but this Eon Concepts bread slicer makes cutting consistent slices easy no matter if thick or thin.
customer_reviews.author: D. R. Adams

customer_reviews.title: Great bread slicer
customer_reviews.text: I love my bread slicer. It took forever to get, but is well worth it if you make a lot of homemade bread. I like how you can adjust it to get different widths of slices too. I’m also glad I bought it when I did. I just noticed it’s gone up from $25.99 to $30.99!
customer_reviews.author: Sunshinegal

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive must have for the homemade bread baker!
customer_reviews.text: Saved this fledgling baker’s mangled attempts to hand cut homemade loaves! Made my slices consistent and thus the loaf stretched further / got more sandwiches per loaf without breaking the bank. Seriously some of the other offerings are like “They want how much”?!
customer_reviews.author: Revolutn

customer_reviews.title: Pile of junk.
customer_reviews.text: This flimsy plastic "thing" broke the first time I tried to use it. Standard size bread maker loafs are too large to fit properly. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Henry F. Smith

customer_reviews.title: I was really surprised how well this works! It's ...
customer_reviews.text: I was really surprised how well this works! It's not quick, as you need to remove the loaf after every slice, but the slices are consistent. I make huge loaves and they fit. I need to finagle it a bit, since my loaves are wide, but it gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Kari

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use - a perfect slice of bread
customer_reviews.text: Used this bread slicer for the first time today. It was very easy to use. Sliced the loaf I made in the breadmaker perfectly. The only thing causing me to rate 4 stars instead of 5 is that my breadmaker makes a loaf that is a little bit wider than the slicer so I have to slice a portion of the loaf off before I can use the slicer. Otherwise, it is a great slicer.
customer_reviews.author: Loves2read555

customer_reviews.title: Nice to have
customer_reviews.text: I have had problems with slicing homemade bread. This device is simple but does help with making nice straight cuts. But I still cannot get it as thin as I would like without the bread crumbling I think that is due to the bread not the device
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not really needed
customer_reviews.text: It’s easy enough to use and clean. But after using it for a few days, I’ve gone back to cutting my bread without it. It just doesn’t make enough of a difference to bother with it.
customer_reviews.author: mda

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I use an electric knife with the slicer guide and I get a perfect slice every time. With a regular bread knife it doesn't work as well. Since you can adjust the thickness I use it for both homemade bread and bagels. That said, its a little cumbersome to use so only 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Robert M. Angelo

customer_reviews.title: It’s average for occasional use
customer_reviews.text: This is handily, however, the form of the plastic isn’t the best. The ironing where the knife goes in is not a consistent width from top to bottom, so I always feel that I will cut part of the plastic. It also shifts a bit as you cut.
customer_reviews.author: DVA

customer_reviews.title: Makes perfect bread slices
customer_reviews.text: I started making my own bread to control the ingredients. This has been very useful for getting perfect bread slices. You can cut slices at various thicknesses. I saw some slicers made of bamboo but I opted for this one because it folds for ease of storage and it seemed easier to clean. I would recommend this as well as getting a good bread knife if you don’t already have one.
customer_reviews.author: Luz A.

customer_reviews.title: Get another bread slicer
customer_reviews.text: The product came in a damaged box with a part broken. I didn't return the item as I can use it without the broken handle. The width is a bit narrow for loaves that have risen over the sides of the baking pan. You also need to be careful or you can slice the plastic while slicing your bread.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Use it every week!
customer_reviews.text: It is great! My last one was used every week for three years and finally broke. This is the same one to replace it. I does what I want it to do and that's all I can ask. I recommend it to anyone making their own bread.
customer_reviews.author: Jaebea

customer_reviews.title: It's going back
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this product. It is described as "high quality" but I would call it flimsy. I almost broke it getting it out of the box, and I don't think it would last very long with normal use. In addition, the "guide" for the knife is not sturdy. Finally, the bread from my very standard bread machine won't fit in it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what I need. And doesn’t take up a hole bunch of space.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Slicing my keto bread
customer_reviews.text: I started baking my own keto bread. At first, I tried to slice them by hand....not a good idea. I now literally know why there is a term called "greatest thing since sliced bread". This little device lets me cut my bread evenly and smooth every time. Make sure you have a long serrated knife or else you will struggle with it.
customer_reviews.author: Bob S.

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.text: This helps me cut my bread so perfect. We use the two smallest sizes to cut out homemade bread and it works perfect. It is plastic so I can see it breaking eventually but so far a couple of weeks of use during almost all 3 meals looks like new. Which I could cut two slices at a time somehow but then that would be a different product haha Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: MRoberts

customer_reviews.title: Kind of satisfied
customer_reviews.text: For what I paid the bread cutter, it's okay. It is a little hard to handle and slips even with 2 grippy at the bottom of it. Maybe if it had 4 and a lock position while cutting the bread?
customer_reviews.author: D S

customer_reviews.title: Used? don't bother
customer_reviews.text: I thought $17.99 item would be better compared to the other brand $10.99. This product was advertised with rubber bottom. But when I received the product, it was same look as the other lower cost brand but with rubber sticker. Also product came with extra item, old green onion... I'll be returning...
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Perfect slices every time
customer_reviews.text: I’m very pleased with this purchase. This is exactly what I needed for an affordable way to slice my homemade bread in perfect slices every time. Easy to change the size of the slices and my bread fit perfectly, which was my biggest worry when searching for a bread slicer.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen B

customer_reviews.title: Kitchen gadget for the donation bin
customer_reviews.text: After the third attempt to use this, I threw it in the donation bin. It was very awkward to use as you had to hold your bread in the holder while pushing it towards the knife. The force you use to do this then pushes the holder around in the counter making it nearly impossible to cut the bread. The little grippy stickers that you have to put on the bottom were useless on my granite countertops. It didn’t break when I used it so I gave it two stars.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Wray

customer_reviews.title: easy to use and clean
customer_reviews.text: easy to use and clean. only problem was at first little pieces of plastic would on bread from the knife cutting the excess plastic in between slice sizing. Can't beat it for the price
customer_reviews.author: Elaine Pietrucha

customer_reviews.title: What a disaster
customer_reviews.text: There’s absolutely nothing good about this product. It’s a serious cut just waiting to happen. I’m going to attempt to return it. Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Queen

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy!
customer_reviews.text: I really wasn't sure if this would work for me. But it is great! Easy to clean, fits my loaves of bread really well. I like being able to adjust the thickness of the slice. I also like that you can fold it up so it takes up less space! The price is excellent too! Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: B. Schildkncht

customer_reviews.title: 3 stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for slicing to your desired thickness but it isn't sturdy - it slips a LOT and the plastic part meant to guide, gets in the way. Maybe use a MUCH longer knife.
customer_reviews.author: H. Roque

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: I love this bread slicer. I recently started making my own bread and this slicer is SO easy to use and clean. I'm actually surprised by how well it works for being so cheap. It's awesome! 10/10
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Great for cutting particular thicknesses of bread - very durable.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my dad who is an avid bread machine user. He loves that he's able to adjust the thickness of each slice. It is very well made and should last a very long time. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: C. Blankenship

customer_reviews.title: The e-book was a surprise
customer_reviews.text: The slicer was just as described and worked well. I was surprised that I received an e-book on how to use a slicer! It seemed obvious. My mistake! I received a well done e-book of bread related recipes. I especially liked the bruschetta.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce J.

customer_reviews.title: This little. Read slicer is Simple design...easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: this little bread slicer is easy to use, easy to clean and the foldable design imakes it easy to fold and store.
customer_reviews.author: Thegirlsmom1

customer_reviews.title: Cheap construction
customer_reviews.text: The fold down bread rest attached by two smail plastic molded pins to the main body. These pins allow the bread rest to be fold when the unit is being stored or not in use. One of the pins broke after less than a month of use and is un repairable. Highly recommend serious buyer consider alternative options.
customer_reviews.author: Ripped Off

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: This has been a game changer for me making low carb bread! It makes perfect slices! Thank you!!!
customer_reviews.author: appytaz

customer_reviews.title: Best thing since...
customer_reviews.text: ...well, you know If you make a large loaf it doesn’t fit so well. Keep them small and you’ll do fine. Does a very good job and makes consistent slices.
customer_reviews.author: Erich Zann

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bread slicer guide!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Best adjustable bread guide ever for slicing homemade bread from bread machine. Order this and don't waste your time and money on the other products that claim to efficiently and effectively slice bread. Been there, done it!! You wont be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great and cheap!
customer_reviews.text: Started making bread regularly and this slicer does what I could not...cut straight. It's cheap plastic so nbn you have to be careful to make it last.
customer_reviews.author: Dana Sugg

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: I love the option to change the width of the slice. This product is worth its weight in Gold
customer_reviews.author: tcm

customer_reviews.title: Unstable and cheap
customer_reviews.text: The idea is good but it is not stable on the counter. Even with the guides it is hard to get even slices as it slips when you slice and it is hard to get the bread flush with the guide as it bends back when you push the bread in. One side has broken after just a couple of months of use. I can still use it until the other side breaks. Going to try a bamboo slicer.
customer_reviews.author: C P

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for smaller loaves
customer_reviews.text: I tried other more expensive bread cutting guides, but they seemed flimsy or too large for my little keto loaves. This small one is just perfect. My knife reaches all the way across (which was a problem with the larger bamboo type guides) and when I am done slicing up my little loaves, this one folds up and can be tucked away. Also very easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: The Speckled Goat, LLC

customer_reviews.title: No problems; works just as described.
customer_reviews.text: Works just as described. I had no problem with cutting plastic bits; just don't press down too hard at the bottom. And before you order, measure your bread machine's baking pan size to ensure your loaves will fit.
customer_reviews.author: Ward Webber

customer_reviews.title: Not large enough for bread machine loaves.
